meaningMnemonic: Wrap <radical>vines</radical> around a <radical>stool</radical> to <kanji>obtain</kanji> it. Don't worry about paying for it, sneak into the stool store and tie some vines around the legs. Then when you leave, pull the vines and the stool will come out after. That's how you obtain a stool!
readingMnemonic: Today you want to <kanji>obtain</kanji> a new pair of <reading>shoe</reading>s (しゅう). You tie your vines around the stool they're on, and slowly inch them toward the door.
